snippet: Questions on how teachers should be evaluated have been added to traditional issues of pay, benefits and working conditions as Chicago teachers walk picket lines.
abstract: What started in Chicago as a traditional labor fight by teachers over pay, benefits and working conditions has exploded into a dramatic illustration of the national debate over how public school districts should rate teachers; at stake are profound policy questions about how teachers should be granted tenure, promoted or fired, as well as the place standardized tests will have in the lives of elementary and high school students.
lead_paragraph: Questions on how teachers should be evaluated have been added to traditional issues of pay, benefits and working conditions as Chicago teachers walk picket lines.
